snippet.textDisplay: I've always liked Colin, since his ign days. He's one of the better ones at his job. However after listening to his channel for about 6 months I found myself kind of annoyed. snippet.textDisplay: By the way, Colin is completely full of $$$$ when he says "i'm lazy, not motivated, etc" . They put out a piece of content every single day across all the diff shows, and this DOES NOT STOP for holidays or anything. Over the holidays they continue to put the content. It is one of the most worth it $5 Patreon subs you will ever find, if you are intersted in all the diff gaming platforms across PS, xbox and switch.

snippet.textDisplay:
People hate Druckmann just because he's an Israeli Jew? What the hell kind of stupid, "I sound smart" take is that? It's connecting two things that have zero to do with each other.
Druckmann is a pompous jerk who never escaped his edgy teenager phase. He's the one who literally spat in the faces of fans who didn't like The Last of Us Part II, calling everyone who hated the game a misogynistic, homophobic, racist.
He totally deserves all the hate he gets, and the hate Intergalactic is getting too. Arrogant creeps like him are going to drive Naughty Dog to the ground.
snippet.textOriginal:
People hate Druckmann just because he's an Israeli Jew? What the hell kind of stupid, "I sound smart" take is that? It's connecting two things that have zero to do with each other.
Druckmann is a pompous jerk who never escaped his edgy teenager phase. He's the one who literally spat in the faces of fans who didn't like The Last of Us Part II, calling everyone who hated the game a misogynistic, homophobic, racist.
He totally deserves all the hate he gets, and the hate Intergalactic is getting too. Arrogant creeps like him are going to drive Naughty Dog to the ground.

snippet.textDisplay:
Arc Raiders gives me the vibe of TLOU online which I adored when it came out. Third person survival with limited resources and thick atmosphere

I think people hate on TLOU 2 because its so much less excellent than TLOU 1. I would even call it mid. The game does not work without Joel and Abby is not an interesting character. It should not have been made as it retroactively makes the first game worse!
snippet.textOriginal:

I think people hate on TLOU 2 because its so much less excellent than TLOU 1. I would even call it mid. The game does not work without Joel and Abby is not an interesting character. It should not have been made as it retroactively makes the first game worse!

snippet.textDisplay: Man I really wish they didn't fumble the look and vibe of Concord so bad cause the actual gameplay was so good if you actually gave it a fair chance and took the time to learn all of the different movement mechanics, perks, and abilities the characters had. It was much better than any other shooter on the current market outside of The Finals imo and after playing both Arc & Marathon I realized that I truly just do not want extraction shooters.

snippet.textDisplay: I think most of the pushback on the girlboss characters doesn't really have a ton to do with the characteristics of the characters themselves. In the case of Intergalactic, i think it's more what the appearance of the protagonist potentially suggests about the game. If the last 5 years are any indication, that type of protagonist is pretty consistent with a blatantly ideological product. Ideological products tend to only appeal to people who subscribe to that ideology, and will alienate a lot people that don't. I think of it like Contemporary Christian music or something. How many Muslims have that kind of music on their Spotify playlist? My guess is not many.
snippet.textOriginal: I think most of the pushback on the girlboss characters doesn't really have a ton to do with the characteristics of the characters themselves. snippet.textDisplay: giving up on TLOU factions might be my biggest gaming what if...i was anticipating that game more than anything else. it will always feel like an astronomical miss to not have explored that. it could have been a huge money maker for the studio and sony for a long time. some major bad decisions were made to send that one out to pasture. not sure what its failure has to do with bungie getting a seat at the table. look how bungie is doing now...

snippet.textDisplay:
Why has ND received so much heat over intergalactic… They don’t like Druckmann because they’re “antisemitic”.

?????
That has got to be the dumbest, trendy, copout answer ever. 
I follow a lot of this stuff and I’ve never ever heard anything of the sort.🙄 

Druckmann spent too many interviews talking about woke politics and how he thinks it’s important in his games. 
That said, I do believe Druckmann has kinda sorta learned a lesson with the HBO series and will avoid the controversy, dilute things down if he’s even involved in it in that respect.
snippet.textOriginal:
Why has ND received so much heat over intergalactic… They don’t like Druckmann because they’re “antisemitic”.

?????
That has got to be the dumbest, trendy, copout answer ever. 
I follow a lot of this stuff and I’ve never ever heard anything of the sort.🙄 

Druckmann spent too many interviews talking about woke politics and how he thinks it’s important in his games. 
That said, I do believe Druckmann has kinda sorta learned a lesson with the HBO series and will avoid the controversy, dilute things down if he’s even involved in it in that respect.

snippet.textDisplay:
Huge Tlou fan here. I love Neil and if you want to know my problem with him now is that he never should be on ND management... He should write and maybe directing games and not do anuthing On top of that in company. It has nothing to do with him being Israeli... you get this wrong. I know there are some guys who probably have problem with that but most of the ppl feels like he became more of an activist than artist and I liked him much more as an artist. First TLOU was great cause of Neils idea but it was executed by him AND Bruce Strailey. The genius of this games was Born from those two not only Neil. Also i think that ND under Neil will descend.. not in quality but in market position. They are releasing only remakes and remasters and they release one game per almost a decade(!) .. Yes im waiting for their games but in this pacing i will play maybe 2-3 of their games in my life and probably 23 remakes in between.... I feel like console gaming is lost and became this huge money making behemoth that dont care about what players want and unfortunetly Neil is one of the frontman of this change... I want to play more games and I dont care about realistic skinpores in my video game. Give me engaging games with average graphics. I dont need my games to be like reality cause I live reality every day and games are about escapism from reality... Neil is great but he is lost imo.


I know intergalactic will be great but it will keep me entertained for a week tops and then i have to wait next decade for next game... im not rushing but come on man....

snippet.textDisplay:
I still believe to this day that Bungie came in and sabotaged ND’s project. 
Remember when they were brought in to critique and to “help them out”?
I think it would’ve done way better than anything Bungie had put out and that was gonna be a problem for them.
Arc Raiders reminds me of what [Factions 2] could’ve been, but without the Syfy elements.
snippet.textOriginal:
I still believe to this day that Bungie came in and sabotaged ND’s project. 
Remember when they were brought in to critique and to “help them out”?
I think it would’ve done way better than anything Bungie had put out and that was gonna be a problem for them.
Arc Raiders reminds me of what [Factions 2] could’ve been, but without the Syfy elements.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's not that I want my game characters to be ****able, it's that I don't want them to be ****ing ugly anymore. I'm sick of picking the least ugly character, I want to go back to being able to make the cutest, girliest characters. I got to be an ugly woman in real life, I don't want to be forced to be one in my escapism
And I'm very excited for the PS Portable

snippet.textDisplay:
You can dislike Neil, but hate is just irrational. I've admired Neil Druckmann for years for his writing. He has taught me a lot about the craft of writing through his multiple interviews, but I simply can't stand with his support for genocidal Israel. And you can't say he gets hate because he's an Israeli Jew and not mention Israel committing Genocide in Gaza against Palestinians.

Since I truly accepted that TLOU P2 portrays Neil's Liberal Zionistic view of Israel-Palestine conflict, after years of arguing against it because I wasn't educated about that conflict, and Neil's total silence as his "Eternity Israel Forever" commits genocide to Palestinians in Gaza and West Bank, even though he shared the Israeli propaganda about beheaded burning babies while he remains silent as Israel literally bombs and snipes babies and children in Gaza, Neil has lost my respect. I have a very conflicting, dissonant, and messy view of him as a person. I admire his ability to creat interesting, complicated characters and tell compelling stories (even after being disillusioned about TLOU P2's portrayal of Israel-Palestine conflict, if you look at it through the lens of universality of tribalistic conflict, it has something to say about human nature), but I can't square that with the reality of his support for Israel. He still has the Israeli flag as a post up on Instagram. Even after it's beyond a shadow of doubt that Israel has committed genocide in Gaza. He even gave an interview to an Israeli newspaper, Haaretz, just before Oct 7th Hamas attack (which was horrible and I condemn Hamas for that) where he just straight up said Liberal Zionist talking points with a hint of condescension like "if you've just done more research, you would know how complicated it is," and "Both sides are hurt" while ignoring the sheer power imbalance between "both sides." Ignoring the statistics of death between "both sides." Ignoring the reality that Israel controls food, water, electricity, and the very lives of Palestinians in Gaza and in the apartheid West Bank. All these things add up. I don't hate him, but I don't respect him as much as I used to do either.

And yes, Antisemitism is a big reason for hate towards him now, and even before Oct 7 (Israel has been committing a slow genocide of Palestinians for decades), but Israel's war crimes play a big part in the rise of it.

He has taught me a lot about the craft of writing through his multiple interviews, but I simply can't stand with his support for genocidal Israel. And you can't say he gets hate because he's an Israeli Jew and not mention Israel committing Genocide in Gaza against Palestinians.

Since I truly accepted that TLOU P2 portrays Neil's Liberal Zionistic view of Israel-Palestine conflict, after years of arguing against it because I wasn't educated about that conflict, and Neil's total silence as his "Eternity Israel Forever" commits genocide to Palestinians in Gaza and West Bank, even though he shared the Israeli propaganda about beheaded burning babies while he remains silent as Israel literally bombs and snipes babies and children in Gaza, Neil has lost my respect. I have a very conflicting, dissonant, and messy view of him as a person. I admire his ability to creat interesting, complicated characters and tell compelling stories (even after being disillusioned about TLOU P2's portrayal of Israel-Palestine conflict, if you look at it through the lens of universality of tribalistic conflict, it has something to say about human nature), but I can't square that with the reality of his support for Israel. He still has the Israeli flag as a post up on Instagram. Even after it's beyond a shadow of doubt that Israel has committed genocide in Gaza. He even gave an interview to an Israeli newspaper, Haaretz, just before Oct 7th Hamas attack (which was horrible and I condemn Hamas for that) where he just straight up said Liberal Zionist talking points with a hint of condescension like "if you've just done more research, you would know how complicated it is," and "Both sides are hurt" while ignoring the sheer power imbalance between "both sides." Ignoring the statistics of death between "both sides." Ignoring the reality that Israel controls food, water, electricity, and the very lives of Palestinians in Gaza and in the apartheid West Bank. All these things add up. I don't hate him, but I don't respect him as much as I used to do either.

And yes, Antisemitism is a big reason for hate towards him now, and even before Oct 7 (Israel has been committing a slow genocide of Palestinians for decades), but Israel's war crimes play a big part in the rise of it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Gee, I can't think of any reason why antisemitism in on the rise? 
It's too easy to point to the fact that Druckmann was raised, at no fault of his own, in settlements built on stolen land.
Antisemitism is a real thing and it's wrong, but asking the question as to why Jews around the world feel so threatened is to be ignorant of the fact that many are staunch supports of the genocide happening in PS, obviously not all. Neil Druckmann supports his country no matter what they do and it's sickening. I love his games and never once questions who he was or his politics. It's insulting to say " Ohh!? It's because he's Jewish" to those that have a real issue with his politics and not his race.

Think of it like how some abuse actual racism by using the race card, same sht different people. Doesn't mean it's not real, but you can't use it to protect your stupid choices sometimes.  

I was more than anything else disappointed in many of the creatives that showed race is more important than justice. 

Peace

snippet.textDisplay: So what people were set off in The Last of US Part 2 was Abby was a playable character. Many people hated Abby for murdering Joel. Not many people cared for her backstory. Even Laura Baily who did the voice for Abby was crying when they all did the shoot together with the cast. There were death threats towards Laura Bailey and her son because everyone hated Abby.

snippet.textDisplay: The entire game goes to great lengths to highlight that everyone in E33 is real and entirely sentient, but Colin's takeaway is "Its not real, why bother". Its fine if the overall plot is not your cup of tea, that's fair. But a comment like this just shows that you understood nothing about the game's narrative. Sometimes I question how game journos build careers in the gaming space when they often have little to no media literacy...It's truly baffling.
snippet.textOriginal: The entire game goes to great lengths to highlight that everyone in E33 is real and entirely sentient, but Colin's takeaway is "Its not real, why bother". Its fine if the overall plot is not your cup of tea, that's fair. But a comment like this just shows that you understood nothing about the game's narrative. Sometimes I question how game journos build careers in the gaming space when they often have little to no media literacy...It's truly baffling.

snippet.textDisplay: Speaking of expedition 33s ending (spoilers obviously) im suprised how not more feel the same like Colin, I remember how split the fanbase was in Star Ocean 3 ending, when it was revealed that the world was created as a mmo game by a 4D programmer, and every world we been explored was "created" and these weird alien ships trying to wipe us out when we leave the galaxies were basically the anti virus program trying to maintain the order in the game. Now obviously the twist in STar Ocean 3 was that they couldnt turn off the game and basically the universe had materialized into something real, and the people living there had their own conscious and wasnt just "a.i" but still. people were really upset and divided, because what was the earlier star ocean games, were it just A.I scripted stories? are Welch just a 4D player who visit the worlds, and not a new character each game etc.
snippet.textOriginal: Speaking of expedition 33s ending (spoilers obviously) im suprised how not more feel the same like Colin, I remember how split the fanbase was in Star Ocean 3 ending, when it was revealed that the world was created as a mmo game by a 4D programmer, and every world we been explored was "created" and these weird alien ships trying to wipe us out when we leave the galaxies were basically the anti virus program trying to maintain the order in the game. snippet.textDisplay:
Agree with Colin completely on Mafia 3. One of the most underrated games I've ever played. While there are definitely some repetitive elements, the gameplay is easily best in the series and the writing is exceptional. I played it for the first time recently and encountered very few technical issues.

The gap between its critical reputation and my experienced is easily the widest I've ever encountered.
snippet.textOriginal:
Agree with Colin completely on Mafia 3. One of the most underrated games I've ever played. While there are definitely some repetitive elements, the gameplay is easily best in the series and the writing is exceptional. I played it for the first time recently and encountered very few technical issues.

The gap between its critical reputation and my experienced is easily the widest I've ever encountered.
